today_in_history_posts.title: Packaged Transaction Relay
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- The Package Relay Proposal aims to propagate non-minimum feerate transactions in Bitcoin.
- Challenges include maintaining a transaction DAG and the impracticality of using BIP 152 shortids.
- Solutions involve fee and weight disclosure during package announcement and potential versioning for protocols.

today_in_history_posts.title: LN Summit 2022 Notes & Summary/Commentary
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- The Lightning Network Dev Summit in Oakland discussed protocol evolution and Taproot updates.
- Attendees explored solutions for channel jamming and bandwidth efficiency in LN Protocol.
- Future research is anticipated for proposals like Blinded Paths and invoice fetching methods.

today_in_history_posts.title: Thoughts on scaling and consensus changes (2023)
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin aims to scale by establishing 50,000 off-chain "bitcoin banks" for transactions.
- Increasing the block size is rejected in favor of optimizing UTXO storage and validation.
- Infrastructure should focus on safe operation tools, Layer 1 exits, and simplifying custodial tasks.
